questions.question: In "Hanging Fire" where is the speaker's mother?

choices.answer: at a dance party
behind a closed door
at a school contest
in the baby's nursery

questions.question: In "Hanging Fire" what does the speaker think about?

choices.answer: vacation
failing a test
her sister
wearing braces

questions.question: In "Translating Grandfather's House" what has the speaker been asked to do?

choices.answer: draw a picture of a relative's house
draw a picture of a favorite movie
draw a picture of a made-up house
draw a picture of a city building

questions.question: Why does the speaker in "Translating Grandfather's House" draw a second picture?

choices.answer: the first picture makes him homesick
the teacher thinks he didn't follow directions
he can't think of a title for the first picture
he decides the first picture did not have correct details

questions.question: Watching the sun set on the horizon means...

choices.answer: You are watching the sun set over a body of water
the sunset is so bright, you cannot look at it for long
the sun is setting exactly where you thought it would
you are seeing the sun at the boundary between earth and sky

questions.question: When are awakenings most likely to happen?

choices.answer: at ends of naps
at moments of great joy
in times of sickness
in times of intense stress

questions.question: Beaming

choices.answer: wondering what is happening
feeling unworthy
giving a bright smile
looking angry

questions.question: What is the best way to describe the speaker in "Hanging Fire?"

choices.answer: hopeful
lonely and overwhelmed
determined
enthusiastic and outspoken

questions.question: Which phrase best supports that she is lonely and overwhelmed?

choices.answer: the boy I cannot live without still sucks his thumb
there is nothing I want to do & too much that has to be done
I have to learn how to dance in time for the next party
I should have been on the Math Team

questions.question: In "Grandfather's House," where is the house in the first picture?

choices.answer: in a hot, dusty place
in a beautiful place with rich soil
in a crowded, noisy place
in a distant place with imaginary people

questions.question: Which phrase supports a beautiful place with rich soil?

choices.answer: rows of lemon & mango trees frame the courtyard
she was born there--right on the second floor
the shadow of a palomino gallops on the lip of the horizon
classmates finish drawings of New York City

questions.question: Why is "Hanging Fire" a lyric poem?

choices.answer: it tells a true story about the poet
it shares facts about the life of a modern-day teenager
it is a poem that can easily be set to music
it presents a focused, powerful impression of the speaker

questions.question: Why is "Translating Grandfather's House" a narrative poem?

choices.answer: it has a plot and other traditional story elements
its main character is similar to the reader
its language sounds musical at times
it has a realistic setting

questions.question: The lines about mama's bedroom door being closed is repeated.Why does this make the poem lyric?

choices.answer: it furthers the plot of the poem
it creates a vivid and constant impression
it hides the poet's powerful feelings
it emphasizes the mother as a strong character

questions.question: What does the repetition of the mama's door being closed say about the speaker of the poem?

choices.answer: it reveals her true talent
it shows how young she really is
it emphasizes her loneliness
it shows how shallow her worries are

questions.question: When the teacher rejects his first picture, how does this help tell the story?

choices.answer: it wraps up the plot
it reveals the conflict
it solves the problem
it establishes the setting

questions.question: How are both poems similar?

choices.answer: both focus on the absence of a caring mother
both focus on the frustrations of a teenager's life
both focus on the fears that people have about the future
both focus on the difference between imagination and reality

questions.question: The Latin gradus means "step" or "grade." So......"suppose I die before graduation" means...

choices.answer: she wonders if anyone will remember her after she dies
she fears she may never progress in her life
She wants to get good grades in her classes at school
she feels sure that she will die soon

questions.question: The teacher scrawls /An A+ in the corner

choices.answer: the teacher is happy to give the speaker the highest grade
the teacher is careless and sloppy in writing the grade
the teacher thinks carefully before writing the grade
the teacher stands stiffly as she writes the grade

questions.question: Which is an example of figurative language?

choices.answer: rows of lemon & mango trees frame the courtyard
crossing her arms she moves on
with wildgrass rising from the sidewalk cracks like widows
beaming, the teacher scrawls an A+ in the corner

questions.question: When the poet says her skin has betrayed her, her use of that word means...

choices.answer: she does not trust people
she cannot understand why she has problems
she feels that life wants to trouble her
she wishes that she were something other than human
